result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery F Lundy

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on January 6, 2023 at 09:30 am.

Bond modified to NO VIOLENT CONTACT with Victim A. Defendant may not discuss the cases with Victim A. 
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no violent contact with Victim A (or their residence)/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

8:51 AM Defendant Jeffery F Lundy in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Jeffery F Lundy.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called to address Motion to Modify Bond filed by Atty Wolff.
Defense requests bond condition of No Contact with Victim A be modified to No Violent Contact in cases 22CF1215 and 22CM1302.
State objects to modification of bond for reasons as stated on the record.
Victim A makes statement to the Court requesting bonds be modified to No Violent Contact.
Court modifies the bonds to No Violent Contact and Defendant may not discuss the case with Victim A.

In case 22CF1215: Defense moves to enter a special plea of NGI and requests an NGI Evaluation under 971.16 be ordered.  Court Grants and order an NGI Evaluation under 971.16.  Court will Appoint Behavioral Consultants.  Evaluation to be filed by 12/30/22.
Bail/bond hearing on November 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. 03:39 PM Defendant Jeffery F Lundy in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court orders WCS monitoring under level 3 but does not order any drug testing.  Arraignment scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
